annotation.TEXT: There's still a gimme 1-up there.
If you don't want to bother changing the Item Memory Index, then I suppose you could move the Yoshi coin in the autoscrolling room 2 tiles to the left.
Oh, that just takes me down here? Well, I guess this is how you're meant to get down here, instead of doing a duck-spin-jump through the floor from above.
You're still calling this a bonus game, even though it's basically just a shop. Also, you're still not stating exactly what each item costs.
Toasty!
Awesome. Now let's go back for the stuff I missed.
(...Awkward silence...)
I can't go back the way I came, but I'm pretty sure I can make an around-the-corner jump and climb up.
Ow, that was me just being careless.
MOOOOOOOoooooooooooo...
Ah, nice. That slope is working correctly now.
Oh, but... now I can't enter the midair pipe... unless I go through the fishy side area again to reset this place.
Oh, since I don't have the Yellow Switch Palace cleared now, I can actually get the key here.
Oh, did you make sure the coin trail exactly matches Mario's flight path from the cannon, Mark D?
Ow again. I gotta get my act together. Anyway, there's no Yoshi coin here, so either the Item Memory Index issue is still present, or you just removed that coin altogether.
Push!
Gotta see whether that ripped cape costs 9 or 10 lives.
And, once again, the YSP doesn't enter a "destroyed" state, although I still can't reenter it.
MOOOONNN!!! So, you just moved it a bit to the left and made it require the P-switch!
Oh, I see how you've changed the platforms here, which does correct one issue.
This way, the player can just barely reach the 1-up, but only if not distracted by the Yoshi coin above first.
Alright, let's see how 3Birdo's Mazy Tower has changed...
That would've been silly if I fell into that pit there. Anyway, this room's no different.
No need to grab every single last coin there.
Still nothing besides a flower up here.
Now, last time I was here, I did away with the Mega Moles above by causing an earthquake with a cape's dive bomb. This time, I have no cape, so...
I wonder if maybe you'd be better off using the layer 3 tide here...
...version 1.5.2 of this! (Am I using the right version this time, Mark D?) Now, because of a change to the overworld, I'm going to start a new game here.
Aww... you little tease. Wait, let me try that again...
However, since the intro is unchanged (and I want to avoid putting "Welcome" in video's subtitle again if I can help it), I've edited out the intro here.
I don't think I ever tried hitting every single turn block here before.
Ohh... I just thought of something that's a potential problem here.
To be cont-- Oh, wait a minute! I nearly forgot about something!
No need to go through that autoscrolling room again, so I'll just go back over the top to return to the midpoint area quickly.
At least there's that flower right there.
I still think that part of the path there looks weird.
What if a player was small Mario, and accidentally jumped onto this turn block as it stopped spinning?
Okay, I wonder if you fixed the Item Memory Index issue regarding the Yoshi coin in this room...
Alright, there's Yoshi coin #4. Now, my theory is that the fifth one will be beyond the blue P-switch door up ahead.
I'm not gonna bother with a block factory here this time.
Nuts. I noticed that I had clipped that invisible wall the first time, so I went for the wall jump, and pulled it off, but I was unable to get past the invisible wall anyway.
Alright, the oscillating speed allowed me to get up there on the second try. (Would there happen to be a hidden block nearby that I never found? Just wondering.)
This message looks the same. Alright, let's check out the rest of Walkla Town now.
Hello, this is SomeBirthdayGuy712x, and welcome to...
Alright, let's see what's different in 2ExGFX Grassland.
Ah, there it is, the missing Yoshi coin! Yeah, so you still have that Item Memory Index issue.
Here's what I would recommend you do: Remove that Yoshi coin and put it in that side room with the unreachable 1-up.
Also, you should make sure Mario will land safely regardless of whether a jump button is held or not.
But now, the left one is missing. So, the left coin in that pair must've been in the same X position of that Yoshi coin in the autoscrolling side room.
Oh, there's a new landmass in the air here.
But, I'm gonna hold off on getting the secret exit for now.
May as well go over here and get the moon and stuff while I'm at it. Oh, and since I started a new game, all the counters have been reset.
Why do I keep taking a dumb hit there? Well, at least I still get my Fire Flower.
Anyway, the glitch involving the payment to enter these shafts has been fixed now. The payment will only occur once I've actually landed on the first ledge.
And, done! Alright, I'm outta here!
This place looks the same as before, I think. I kinda do like the design of this coin room.
Blast. Still can't get to that 1-up in time. Mark D told me that was intentional.
Goal tape average: 40 / 1 = 40 stars each.
Oh, but what's this?
Star power, activate!
Anyway, let's try this again, shall we?
Whoops, I missed 2 coins there, but maybe I can reach them with a max speed jump.
Okay, now I definitely want that P-switch so that I can check out that blue door I saw near the end of this place last time.
HARRY S. TRUMAN UP!
Got it! I was hoping to avoid getting hit by the Mega Mole as I went for it, but whatever. You might actually be forced to take a hit to get that moon if you don't have a cape.
And, I get dropped to 32, so once again, it only costs 9 lives. If you can't fix it so that it properly costs 10, then change the Toad's text so that he says it costs 9.
This part of the landmass above is still non-solid.
So, next time, it'll be time 4Waterfall Canyon, for realsies!
Yeah, I'll just leave those guys down there alone.
This guy still says the cost is 10 lives. Did you fix it so that it really does cost 10, or does it still actually cost 9?
Alright, that officially reveals level 2. Now to quickly revisit level 1 for the secret exit.
BGM: Super Mario Sunshine - Shine Get!
Ow, stupid Shy Guy...
I see an additional Yoshi coin right there, but where did the saws go? Uhh... I think there's a problem there, but I'll get back to that in a moment.
Wall jump count: 1
Alright, so let's see what's new here... Uhh...
That gimme 1-up is still here. Are you ever going to change that?
Alright, let's go gather up the rest of the Yoshi coins here now.
Alright, let me ludicrously speed through the Yellow Switch Palace (which is unchanged, as far as I can tell).
I notice a little graphical addition made to the left arch ledge here, and there's now a Yoshi coin on top of the right one, where the secret exit once was in the past.
Well, let's check out what's new in Walkla Town. Oh, I see something new right away. (Oh, and BTW, I did successfully transfer over the coin the demo collected this time.)
Owww... Mark D, you gotta fix that. Anyway, I picked up Yoshi coin #5 right there, so I don't have to worry about those in this level anymore.
The green coin and star are still in the same places up here. Alright, let's try going on a rampage to build up some lives for the ripped cape now!
Well, let's burninate Birdo.
Alright, the oscillating speed let me up there on the first attempt that time. Oh, and what's this? Aha, there's normally 2 loose coins above those turn blocks there.
Anyway, let's check out level 1 now.
In fact, place the Yoshi coin like 4-5 tiles above the door in that room, then move the 1-up one space to the left so that it's just barely reachable in time.
7-life combo!
This one's the same.
Umm... Okay... The two shells there just destroyed each other, but didn't hit any of the Bros. on the left.
Whoa, what the?! Okay, yeah, about those saws...
DOUBLE KILL!
Well, first of all, this level now starts me with 400 seconds instead of 300.
Whoa! That saw is new!
Whoa, I never knew that pop-up 1-up was there. Was that always there, even in previous versions?
Put a vine or a couple of rope ledges above the turn block. This way, the player can just jump/climb off the top of the screen and fall down the entry shaft to the left.
Moon count: 2
Go, my yellow ! blocks, and do the same thing you did before!
Huh, the green coins here have been replaced with 4-packs of regular coins.
Okay, I'm at 41 now... (Wasn't I at 41 last time I bought this cape as well? Interesting coincidence there.)
I have a sneaking suspicion that the missing Yoshi coin is in that other autoscrolling room, but failed to appear due to an Item Memory Index overlap with this area.
Well, this is new! That pipe wasn't enterable in the previous versions!
Aww... The moon over here was replaced with a 1-up...
Alright, I'm gonna head back in and go straight to that autoscrolling side room without touching anything else.
Moon count: 4
I can still skip to midpoint very quickly.
BGM: Untitled small tune, by Mark D
!-switch jumps: 1
Goal tape average: 80 / 2 = 40 stars each.
Yeah, that broken line-guide really screwed with that saw!
Alright, that'll do. Now I know none of them contain anything besides that one Fire Flower.
Alright, well I'm not gonna buy anything more here. Let's see if anything else in Walkla Town is different.
Whoops, that hasn't been fixed yet. Put tile 1EB (or a tile that acts like it) under the lower-left corner of that pipe!
But, the way certain fish are behaving with this setup just looks weird, such as that one that jumped between two of the pools and fell below the playing area.
Well, I only have 7 lives right now, so I can't check it yet. I'll try to remember to do so later.
And let's not fall into the now-deadly pit this time.
Alright, now I'm done with this episode. Now to leave you guys with delicious Google-style birthday cakes. To be continued... Yo!
Mark D? I think you might've screwed something up here. I shouldn't be allowed to go to level 2 before beating level 1, right?
Anyway, MOOOONNN!!! And, I'm still missing Yoshi coin #5.
Alright, that's Yoshi coin #5.
And, thanks to that now-broken line-guide, the saws just go flying off wherever.
So, to fix this, go to "Change Properties in Header" (the Mario head on the taskbar), and change the Item Memory Index for this level to a different value (if it's 0, make it 1).
And it still puts me in front of the wrong door when I return to the ripped cape room.
I believe there's a moon behind that upper-right Mega Mole...
Now, see where you placed this new Yoshi coin? Look very closely at what you did to the line-guide there. You overlapped part of it with the Yoshi coin.
Alright, let's check out... whoops!
I wonder what this springboard is actually intended for? I use it for convenience here, but I haven't seen anything in this level absolutely require its usage...
Wow, that was just a dumb hit on my part.
Moon count: 3
Alright, let's play Mario Rampages Again!
Yeah, the player would then be stuck. However, I've thought of a solution to this problem...
Oh, this door works now? And there's a reward for me behind it? Is it a moon?
Also, the mid-level autoscroller still exists. Remember that if the player is near the autoscroller (but hasn't triggered it yet), then L/R scrolls into it, the game softlocks.
I still don't know what the deal is with that pipe visible to the right on the other side of the wall back there.
Moon count: 1
Demo count: 1
Heh, I can shoot my fireballs through the corner here, but this isn't a level design flaw, as this is possible on almost any corner like this.
Wait, this is the intro message. Shouldn't this Toad be telling me about places like a snowy cliff and another grassland? Mark D, did you misplace this guy's message?
Mark D, did you accidentally allow rightward and upward travel from level 1 by default?
Oh, I see a new Yoshi coin on that ledge with the red Koopa.
Whoa, holy pudding!
Umm... Okay, I slipped and fell there, but why did I die instead of being warped to that Hammer Bro. area? Mark D, did you remove that, either accidentally or intentionally?
(...Awkward silence...)
Oh, and apparently the cape has been nerfed a bit more. Now, the height I gain on initial takeoff is no higher than if I did a max speed jump without a cape.
I believe I've been told that the left shaft here (which has a 1-up) costs 50 coins to enter. That would be a good deal, if I had 50 coins right now.
Ooh, the 5th Yoshi-- Oh?
